author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1709096023}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561199224287509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1711533448}
review:
Grimoire Chronicles √© um jogo indie feito no RPG Maker XP.

A narrativa gira em torno de tr√™s grupos distintos: as bruxas, os templ√°rios que as perseguem (chamados de Predadores) e os rebeldes (bandidos da montanha). O jogo explora bem o moralismo, j√° que nem todos os membros de cada grupo s√£o necessariamente bons ou maus. A hist√≥ria e os personagens s√£o bacanas e ajudam a manter o interesse no jogo, mas infelizmente, o "terceiro ato" foi visivelmente feito √†s pressas e deixou muitas pontas soltas.

Os gr√°ficos s√£o bonitos e usam alguns tilesets raros, porem alguns cen√°rios possuem bugs. Outro problema ocorre numa cutscene onde bandidos perseguem um trem em movimento (s√≥ que usaram um cen√°rio parado ao inv√©s de um panorama (nota: por padr√£o o RMXP n√£o suporta panoramas que se movem, mas isso pode ser resolvido com scripts). Os inimigos do jogo possuem todos gr√°ficos originais, evitando o uso do RTP.

A trilha sonora tamb√©m √© boa e tamb√©m evita o uso dos sons padr√µes do RMXP.

O maior ponto negativo √© a jogabilidade:
* Inimigos s√£o vis√≠veis no mapa e representados por bolas de fuma√ßa, mas os cen√°rios s√£o t√£o estreitos que na maioria das vezes √© dif√≠cil evitar uma batalha. No come√ßo, fugir das lutas fazia o inimigo desaparecer do mapa, mas isso n√£o ocorre no restante do jogo por algum motivo.
* O jogo usa o sistema de batalha padr√£o do RMXP, mas os her√≥is n√£o possuem gr√°ficos representando eles,  o que muitas vezes torna dif√≠cil dizer quem est√° atacando.
* A variedade de inimigos √© bem baixa (geralmente 2 tipos diferentes por dungeon) e as batalhas carecem de estrat√©gia, podendo ser vencidas fazendo todo mundo usar ataque normal. Batalhas contra chefes n√£o s√£o muito diferentes, j√° que magias de status (como a de adormecer) funciona em tudo.
* O jogo possui v√°rios sidequests, mas carece de um "quest log" pra organizar tudo.

Sendo franco, Grimoire Chronicles n√£o √© um jogo muito bom, mas a hist√≥ria, os gr√°ficos e a trilha sonora s√£o decentes e eu o considero um dos "melhores" (ou menos piores) lan√ßamentos da Warfare Studios (junto com Storm of Spears). Se estiver numa boa promo√ß√£o, eu posso recomendar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798654233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1693111127}
review:
You either sometime enjoy warfare studios games at the end of the day or don't.  It's laid back.  I will play through it slowly when i tire of other things - which i do.

PROS:  some new graphics all new story with a german-country theme, but music and many things have not changed (much), and this is not un-common from the (series)

CONS:  the NPC/enemy was re-used so many times i checked youtube to see if there were more.  yes there are many NPC but you get say 2-3 per area only.  many areas/chapters though.

These games are "old school" (per say) and not much to it, the graphics are re-used.  So you expect not to pay much for it.

Youtube has a full walkthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131701503', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1684597165}
review:
I can't exactly recommend this game, but I don't bear any negative feelings towards it.  This comes across as someone's first attempt, when they had ideas but lacked the skills and experience to follow through.  There's a certain charm that comes from that, which did get me somewhat invested.  But unless you're me or you know the developers, that probably won't be enough.

The gameplay is pretty standard fair.  If you've played pretty much any RPGmaker RPG, you'll be familiar with this.  Enemies are all visible on the game map, a good idea which in principle means you can avoid them, but the narrow corridors make this often impossible.  The combat screen is very lacking in animation, and most enemies are extremely easy, which makes combat rather boring.  The low difficulty undermines the way your party keeps changing for story reasons.  New party members [i]should[/i] keep things fresh by forcing you to change your tactics and try out new things, but when most encounters can be most quickly won by just spamming the attack button, this potential is lost.  Aside from combat, there are some scavenger hunt side quests.  As noted by other reviewers, there's no quest logs and you can't always replay the quest giver information, so be prepared to take notes.

While the mechanics are pretty standard, the story is a more interesting tale.  I definitely have the impression that this is where the developer put most effort.  The world is low fantasy, familiar but not generic.  There's some effort in the world building and especially in the characters.  Sadly, what potential there might have been is undercut by bad writing in a [i]technical[/i] sense.  Little to no punctuation, awkward and unnatural dialogue; it all feels like someone's first efforts.

I played [b]Grimoire Chronicles[/b] to completion; I cared enough to see the ending, and had some fun along the way.  And, it is far, [i]far[/i] from the worst RPGmaker game I have ever played.  Still, there are so many alternatives out there that I can't honestly recommend.

review:
Grimoire Chronicles, Warfare Studios tarafƒ±ndan geli≈ütirilen ve yayƒ±nlanan b√ºy√ºleyici bir RPG'dir. Oyun, sava≈üla par√ßalanmƒ±≈ü bir d√ºnyada en iyi arkada≈üƒ±nƒ± kurtarmak i√ßin yola √ßƒ±kan gen√ß bir cadƒ± olan Myra'nƒ±n yolculuƒüunu takip ediyor. Hikaye, oyuncularƒ±n kesinlikle keyif alacaƒüƒ± b√ºy√ºl√º bir macera haline getirerek, kƒ±vrƒ±mlar ve d√∂n√º≈üler, ihanet, arkada≈ülƒ±klar ve hatta belki de a≈ükla doludur.

author: {'steamid': '76561199145215165', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1670420506}
review: My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a Virtual Youtuber empire for over a year now and using me as his recruiter. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my Live2D knowledge to recruit talents, which he would then hire using his connections in the Japanese utaite world. Connections that he made through his career with Niconico. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small indie channel could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Motoaki "Yagoo" Tanigo, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Yagoo threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Yagoo had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Yagoo flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Yagoo was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Riku Tazumi , he plotted to kill Yagoo, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Cover Corp, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my vtubing activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1655181660}
review:
RPG Maker strikes again! 

Grimoire Chronicles is one of hundreds of low effort retro-pixel JRPG ripoffs spamming the Steam catalog, made with the RPG Maker video game construction kit... in their own words, "Our easy to use tools are simple enough for a child."  Like all RPG Maker "games", this is essentially a bunch of low quality/canned assets from RPG Maker coupled with a cringeworthy high school anime club weeaboo fan fiction. Basically, these guys didn't make a game, they filled out a couple of templates in a construction kit.

This has a very mediocre plot where you control a young witch girl at a magic school who has to go save her friend, blah blah.  What's notable is both how badly written this is, and how badly it was translated into English.  Google Translate would do a better job. 

Like all RPG Maker games, the poor quality engine displays badly in fullscreen and doesn't have full HD support or any graphics tweaking options.  Resolution is locked and the game features 2D retro pixel art asset flips.  All of this makes this unacceptable for any dedicated modern PC gamer.  The point can be made that the intention of RPG Maker is to make demos and small games to pass around friends, and shouldn't be used for "professional" game development, and the poor quality of this game supports that. 

Gamers who want a good retro JRPG experience would be better off playing the originals, like Final Fantasy, Star Ocean or Chrono Trigger.  Leave this terrible fan fiction in the shovelware bundles where it belongs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164871081', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 839, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1566259552}
review:
Una buona storia √® ci√≤ che mi spinge a giocare e in origine Grimoire Chronicles sembrava promettente. Solo che non potevo sopportarlo per pi√π di un'ora. Il problema sta nel dialogo. Tradotto male e non usare le parole per combinare le frasi, i personaggi sembrano ottusi e poco attraenti.

C'era anche qualcosa che non aveva senso per me. La festa si riprenderebbe automaticamente prima di entrare in un combattimento importante, ma se trascorressero una notte a riposare (a causa della trama) la mattina seguente avrebbero ancora gli stessi PS e PS di ieri.

Alcuni problemi con la mappatura che ho notato, nella prima citt√† ho attraversato una sorta di muro.

Bene, quello che mi √® piaciuto √® stato come il gioco avrebbe cambiato i protagonisti. Gioca nei panni della strega e nella parte successiva come predatore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355947196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2079, 'last_played': 1555785400}
review: Great old time RPG! Just remember to take lots of notes as there is no journal. For you newbies out there, press the X button on your keyboard to get into and out of your menu or to cancel/back up on an option, either use the spacebar or enter key to either jump/activate/talk, and arrow keys to move around. Just make sure that your mouse pointer isn't in the middle of your screen, that way you can select stuff/enemies. Cute story lines. I have laughed out loud on some of the banter between the characters. Don't hesitate to buy stuff or explore areas, as you will rotate between characters, but you will carry your items  that are not equipped no matter who is in the current party. If you really want to go old school, buy some graph paper and make your own maps, as there is no menu map. This one makes you think and works the grey matter between your ears. Have fun! Oh, and if you are looking for a walkthrough if you get stuck, BFG has a few.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056536414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 424, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1537313060}
review:
Que puis-je vous dire sur Grimoire Chronicles... pour ce que j'ai pay√© avec 87% de rabais, c'√©tait un jeu correct. La meilleure partie du jeu √©tait l‚Äôhistoire, qui s‚Äôest plut√¥t bien d√©roul√©e, sauf pour les derni√®res minutes du jeu. La pire partie du jeu √©tait le dialogue, qui √©tait √©videmment √©crit par des auteurs pour lesquels l'anglais n'√©tait pas leur langue principale. Beaucoup de mots mal orthographi√©s, de mots manquants et un manque total de grammaire et de syntaxe (surement traduit par google). Juste b√¢cl√© et tr√®s, tr√®s mauvais dialogue (sexiste, raciste et vulgaire). 

Les graphismes de bataille sont m√©diocres, mais une fois que vous obtenez le sort Paralyze, il n'y a pas un seul Boss que vous ne pouvez pas envoyer rapidement, m√™me le Boss final √† la fin. En outre, oubliez de terminer toutes les qu√™tes secondaires. Vous n'en aurez pas besoin de toute fa√ßon. 

Vous recevrez 3 cartes de collection sur 5 et 6 succ√®s facilement gagn√©s. Si vous pouvez obtenir le jeu pour 0,62 $, comme je l'ai fait, il y a des fa√ßons pires de perdre votre temps, sinon, je ne puis pas recommander ce jeu.

Amicalement
Le pasteur

author: {'steamid': '76561198198474213', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1592157068}
review:
A good story is what draws me to play games and originally, Grimoire Chronicles sounded promising. Except I couldn't stand it for more than an hour. The problem lies in the dialogue. Badly translated and not using words to combine sentences just makes the characters look dull and not appealing.

There was also something that didn't make sense to me. The party would automatically recover before entering an important fight but if they spend a night resting (because of the plot) the following morning they would still have the same hp and sp from yesterday.

Some problems with the mapping that I noticed, in the first town I crossed over some sort of wall.

Well, what I did like was how the game would switch protagonists. Play as the witch and in the next part as the predator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065209195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2858, 'last_played': 1509413292}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1507591232}
review:
This appears to be a port of an older game. That said it was a very well-made game. You start as a witch, trying to rescue your friend, who has been captured by a group that wishes to kill all magic users. Through events beyond your total control, you have to ally with members of that faction, and others, in order to save people and do good deeds. And in the end, you may not be able to overcome all the prejudices arrayed against you.

Worth a purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198724758952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1506468703}
review:
For what I paid for it, this was an OK game. Just OK. The best part of the game was the story, which was handled pretty well, 
except for the last minutes of the game. The worst part of the game was the dialogue, which was obviously written by authors for which English was not their primary language. Lots and lots of misspelled words, missing words, and a total lack of grammar and syntax. Just sloppy and very, very bad. The battle graphics are poor, but once you obtain the Paralyze spell, there is not a single Boss you can't dispatch quickly, even the Final Boss at the end. Also, forget about finishing all the side quests. There is no way I could come up with to find all the junk needed to accomplish it all. You won't need to anyway. It's too bad the developers did not do the sequel set up at the end of the game, because it would have been nice to see if their skills got any better. I guess we will not find out.  If you can obtain the game for $1.50 like I did, there are worse ways to waste your time, otherwise, I cannot recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011891156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1493387600}
review:
This is a wonderful RPG Maker game with a fantastic storyline.

On the surface, the graphics are average quality and there are some typographical errors in the text. However, despite the less than polish aspects, the game itself is actually very well design.

The gameplay feels EPIC as you are playing a team that comprises of individuals in multiple key factions in the game world. In the gameworld, you have the Rebels (evil) who killed and plunder villages, the Witches faction (neutral), the Predators (neutral) who hunt witches, the Queen (good) who fight the rebels and the Church which support the Predators.

However, what I love about this game is the deep emotional interplay between the various groups, as things are not what it seems on the surface. There are honorable people within the Rebels that try to save the villages. There are dishonorable leaders in the Predators that tries to aligned themselves with the massacres of villages and pin the blame of the witches. So as you play the game, you are always discovering new things in the factions as it evolved.

You are playing a group of 10 individuals (from different factions including Witches, Predators, Rebels, Queen, Church, etc) that are brought together by circumstances to fight evil,  combat injustices and protect the villagers. Wow, what a noble force of good!! However, your group will start off as the underdog, as the leaders of certain factions are trying to blame you for things that you did not do. You also have to fight off strong prejudices because things are certainly not what it seems on the surface in the various factions. For example, one of the faction leader who is a decorated war hero  (highly respected and idolized by many villagers) is actually in cohort with the evil Rebels to massacre villages. People would rather believe the war hero than believe you.

As a force of good, you will also need to fight propaganda made by other factions to hurt you. You will need to win allies and make new friends. You will need to bring peace among different faction members in your team. What I like is the emotional experience that the game bring. I spend 30 hours in the game, and feels that it is very immersive.

There are only 6 achievements in the game, and I did not get my first achievement until I was almost  15 hours into the game. The achievements are well made and not buggy and you can get them all in a single playthrough. However, getting the achievements can be difficult.

This is also one of the older RPG maker games where you actually have to keep pen and paper records of all the details of the side quests. There are about 20 side quests, but the game does not have a Quest Tab to track down information for you. This is  old school, cos you have to write them down, otherwise it is so easy to forget or missed out the details, like location of quest givers, etc. Many of the side quests are also very important because the quest rewards include Relics that are key to completion of the game. Relics in this game are special items that enable you to perform various actions in the game world. For example, there are Angel Wings Relic that enable you to jump across different location, Destroyer Relic that enable you to smash a wall so that you can get treasures behind them, etc. So, without doing all the sidequest, you will be missing out on many items and locations in the games and will not have a strong enough final team to defeat the big bosses.

I love this game and for $2.79 it is an enjoyable 30 hours for me. However, the fact that this game DOES NOT automatically track quests may be a big turn-off for many gamers except the truely old school, hard cores. However, I do love it.
